alert.note: Alert for Umatilla (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 29 at 11:02AM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oregon, including the following county, Umatilla. * WHEN...Until 400 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1057 AM PDT, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring on county roads at the base of the Blue Mountains in southern Umatilla County. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Bell Cow Creek, Tutuilla Creek, North Coyote Creek, South Patawa Creek, Stewart Creek, Squaw Creek, Little Johnson Creek, Ensign Creek, Johnson Creek, Calamity Creek, Pearson Creek, North Fork McKay Creek, Little Pearson Creek, McKay Creek, Twomile Creek, Snipe Creek, Little McKay Creek, South Coyote Creek, Little Squaw Creek, Lost Pin Creek, McCoy Creek, Jennings Creek, Beaver Creek, Umatilla River, Little Sevenmile Creek, Birch Creek, Wegner Creek, Sevenmile Creek, East Birch Creek, Lake Creek, Meacham Creek, Little Beaver Creek, Stanley Creek, Meadow Creek, Patawa Creek, Rail Creek, Tod Creek and Ray Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Meacham and Umatilla Reservation. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
